intro: Pavetta fascifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Pavetta fascifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along streambanks.
